problem_statement:
In the Chamber of Secrets, Harry Potter needs to perform a spell to rotate the ingredients of a potion to the left.
 The ingredients of the potion are stored in an array of size 'n'. Harry needs to perform 'r' rotations,
 where each rotation shifts each element of the array one unit to the left.
 Can you help Harry write a spell to perform the rotations and return the result?

May the magic be with you!

Input
The first line contains two space-separated integers n (1 ≤ n ≤ 10^5) and r (1 ≤ r ≤ 10^9),
 the number of integers and the number of left rotations to perform repectively.

The second line contains n integers a1, a2, a3, … , an (1 ≤ ai ≤ 10^9) — the array itself.

Output
Output n space separated integers representing the rotated array.

Notes
The sample test case can be simulated as below,

Performing r = 3 rotation to the left,

{ 2, 4, 1, 5, 3 } - given array

{ 4, 1, 5, 3, 2 } - rotation 1

{ 1, 5, 3, 2, 4 } - rotation 2

{ 5, 3, 2, 4, 1 } - rotation 3
